title: Webcam feed breaking with backgrounds
body:
**Describe the bug**
When using the webcam with a background (such as blur, "in the zone 1", or "in the zone 2") the camera will zoom in, stretch (causing a lot pixelation), which then causes blurring all of the camera space. Making the camera unusable for meetings. 

You can temporarily resolve it by removing the background, but then reapplying it will cause the issue to comeback.

**To Reproduce**
Steps to reproduce the behavior:
- Start meeting
- Turn on webcam with blur/background
- Wait

**Expected behavior**
A nice crisp webcam focused on me - with a blurry background

**Screenshots**
If applicable, add screenshots to help explain your problem.

**Desktop (please complete the following information):**
 - OS: fedora 40 - gnome 46.5
 - Installation package flatpak (1.10.2), Also tried RPM 1.10.2 and the latest pre release 1.11 appimage
